basics.name: Camille Petitalot
basics.label: Tech Lead & DevOps
basics.summary: I enjoy learning and tackling technical challenges, and the "you build it, you run it" philosophy aligns perfectly with my nature. I'm also very interested in FinOps-related issues, particularly when it comes to protecting our beautiful planet.

work.summary: I worked as a developer for Michelin, where I joined a team of several developers as part of a large, multi-team project. My primary responsibility was to build an API that allowed the manipulation of tire measurements as well as the associated reference data. This API played a key role in ensuring the accurate handling of data related to tire performance and characteristics.
highlights: Maintain and update existing code base
Git, Java, Vert.X, Grails, Quarkus, MongoDB, MySQL, Grafana, Splunk, InfluxDB, Docker, AngularJS, Neo4J, Kubernetes

work.summary: During this mission, I took on a lead position within the team I was working in, where I was responsible for making key architecture decisions and reporting on the work being carried out by my team. This role required strong leadership and technical oversight to ensure the success of the projects we were involved in.
highlights: Git, Java, Quarkus, MongoDB, Neo4J, Gitlab CI, Azure Cloud, Terraform, Ansible

work.summary: I worked for Enedis (Paris). I helped implement a new structural component using Kafka and the Scala programming language. Additionally, I contributed to another project that enabled users to access various reports created by the team in PowerBI through a web portal.
highlights: Accessing power bi embedded reports with custom OAuth

work.summary: I joined a small team tasked with setting up a web portal at Michelin, aimed at exposing APIs and datasets that Michelin intended to offer to the public and monetize. In this project, I took on a DevOps role, managing the infrastructure and optimizing the performance of the site within Michelin's ecosystem.
highlights: Git, Azure Cloud, Ansible, Drupal, Gitlab CI

work.summary: I had the opportunity to start a new exploratory project with a young colleague for a local client. This project allowed us to get hands-on experience and test MAUI, Microsoft's new framework for cross-platform mobile development. It was a great chance to dive into this emerging technology.

I joined the DevOps transversal team at Michelin Mobility Intelligence, where I am responsible for automating deployment tasks and managing the infrastructure of their website. This role involves ensuring efficient operations and scalability for their web platform.
highlights: Git, Azure Cloud, WordPress, Gitlab CI, Azure Devops, Ansible

volunteer.summary: I am a member of the association that organizes Volcamp, a conference held in the heart of the Auvergne volcanoes, which focuses on tech topics related to IT professions. It's a great event that brings together professionals and enthusiasts to discuss the latest trends and developments in the industry.
I am also a temporary teacher, sharing my knowledge and experience in the field with students and helping them develop their skills in technology and IT.
